name: Avoid using strlen() function family
description: This rule searches for C/C++ functions, methods, constructors, and destructors that call 'strlen' group of functions.
output:
Associated to each C/C++ function/method/constructor/destructor with violations, the Quality Rule provides:
- Number of violation occurrences
- Bookmarks for violation occurrences found in the source code:
  - 'strlen()' function call
rationale: The 'strlen()' function requires to have a null-terminated sequence of chars to return the size of the string. Otherwise it will return an incorrect length that may lead to memory allocation troubles or security problems.
remediation:
Check if the buffer is correctly null-terminated before using the 'strlen()' function. This can be done by setting the 'sizeof(buf)-1' position to 0. 
You can also use a more secure variant of the function: 'strlen_s()'.

qualityStandards.name: Buffer Copy without Checking Size of Input ('Classic Buffer Overflow')
qualityStandards.description: The program copies an input buffer to an output buffer without verifying that the size of the input buffer is less than the size of the output buffer, leading to a buffer overflow.
